Israeli forces captured the last two of six Palestinian militants who escaped from a maximum security Israeli jail on September 19, 2021.
The two militants were apprehended in the Palestinian city of Jenin in the occupied West Bank.
The two militants are Ayham Nayef Kamamji and Munadel Yacoub Infeiat.
Kamamji was arrested in 2006 and is serving a life sentence, while Infeiat was arrested in 2019.
The other four militants were captured a week ago near the Arab city of Nazareth in northern Israel.
Palestinians in Jenin clashed with Israeli troops during the raid to capture the two militants.
Kamamji and Infeiat surrendered after being surrounded by Israeli forces, and two other Palestinians were arrested for assisting them.
Palestinians have protested in support of the six militants across the West Bank and East Jerusalem.
Members of Israel's Arab minority have also demonstrated in support of the militants.
b86e6d5266bd06a512bea44baece7c0b:
Israeli authorities transferred the six Palestinian prisoners who escaped from Gilboa prison to solitary confinement in various prisons.
The six prisoners will be indicted on Sunday.
The legal battle against the security charges will begin on Sunday.
Israeli authorities extended the detention of the six prisoners until Sunday.
Five others have been accused of helping the prisoners and covering up their escape.
The six Palestinian prisoners escaped from Gilboa prison on 6 September through a tunnel they dug under the prison floor.
All six prisoners were recaptured within weeks.
d81ff9d5977983ea97efbe4a7411c648:
Six Palestinian prisoners escaped from the Gilboa prison in early September by digging a tunnel shaft through layers of steel and concrete.
The prisoners likely crumbled the concrete on the floor of the cell using acid or Coca Cola soft drink.
The escape tunnel is about 35 meters long, 29 meters of which the prisoners dug themselves, with an average diameter of 0.5 meters.
The prisoners disposed of the excavation material through the sewers.
The prisoners have been transferred to solitary confinement in various prisons.
Mahmoud al-Ardah is being held in a small and dirty cell in Ashkelon prison and is considering a hunger strike if his prison conditions worsen.
Zakaria Zubeidi is being held in the notorious desert prison of Eshel in the Negev.
Ayham Kamةji has been moved to solitary confinement in Ohli Kedar prison.
Yaqoub Qadri has been moved to Rimonim prison.
Munadel Nfeiat and Mahmoud Abdullah Ardah have been moved to Ayalon prison in Ramla.
f75aa2eec5678790a8c3aeb90725ad43:
Israel's public attorney has indicted six Palestinian prisoners who escaped from a high-security prison last month.
The indictment includes illegal fleeing from confinement, which could lead to up to 7 years in prison.
The indictment does not include terror-related charges.
Five others were also indicted for assisting the six prisoners with the jailbreak.
The six prisoners were handed over to the Israeli prison authority on Thursday after the end of the investigation by Israel's internal security service, Shin Bet.
The prisoners were placed in solitary confinement in different prisons.
Six Palestinians escaped from Gilboa prison on September 6 by digging a tunnel from their cell to outside the prison.
Israeli forces recaptured all six prisoners after almost a week of their prison break.
There are around 4,850 Palestinian detainees in Israeli prisons, including 40 women, 225 children, and 40 administrative detainees.
d07d0b9c6af0670392c32a1f065ffbe8:
Six Palestinian prisoners who escaped from an Israeli prison in September were formally indicted on Sunday.
The men were charged with escaping from the high-security Gilboa Prison in northern Israel while five others were accused of assisting them.
The inmates, five from the Palestinian Islamic Jihad group and one belonging to the armed branch of the Palestinian Authority's Fateh faction, had been held for attacks against Israel.
The six, hailed as heroes by Palestinians, were recaptured in batches during a major Israeli manhunt in September.
Israel has launched an investigation into how they pulled off their daring escaping.
935ba0ad9898c488d6909aa904b09039:
The Northern District Attorney’s Office filed an indictment against six prisoners who broke out of the Gilboa Prison on Sept. 6.
The State Attorney’s Office filed a statement of prosecution against the escaped prisoners and five additional inmates who aided them.
The final filed charges focused solely on the actions of illegal fleeing confinement, excluding terror-related charges leaked to the media.
Zakaria Zubeidi, a Fatah commander responsible for multiple terrorist attacks and killing many Israelis, was the most prominent escapee.
The escape exposed a series of failures at the prison, including sleeping guards, unmanned watchtowers, and a shortage of staff.
The investigation of the incident is headed by the Lahav 433 Major Crimes Unit.
b939e96ba9e1c60d3d4011302f0254e4:
Six Palestinian prisoners who escaped from an Israeli prison in September were formally indicted on Sunday.
The men were charged with escaping from the high-security Gilboa Prison in northern Israel while five others were accused of assisting them.
The inmates, five from the Palestinian Islamic Jihad group and one belonging to the armed branch of the Palestinian Authority's Fateh faction, had been held for attacks against Israel.
The six, hailed as heroes by Palestinians, were recaptured in batches during a major Israeli manhunt in September.
Israel has launched an investigation into how they pulled off their daring escaping.
8e0c5d11a74aca8d6ab7e9846da2dd87:
Israeli forces detained 14 Palestinians during a wide incursion operation in the occupied West Bank on Monday.
The forces detained six Palestinians from Nablus, six from Bethlehem and two from Hebron.
The detention is part of the Israeli crackdown on Palestinian activists.
400ef4df978ab662995e4064e88a839f:
Iran has invested in building its own submarines, including the Fateh-class submarine, to become a self-sufficient military power.
The Fateh-class submarine is between forty and forty-eight meters long and displaces about six hundred tons submerged, with four bow torpedo tubes and a circular sonar array.
The Fateh-class submarine can operate up to two hundred meters below the surface and has a maximum speed of between fourteen and twenty-three knots while submerged.
Iran is also developing the Besat- or Qaem-class submarines, which are sixty meters long and displace 1,200 to 1,300 tons, with six torpedo tubes and a diving depth of three hundred meters.
Iran is developing the Hoot supercavitating torpedo, which can reportedly attain speeds of over two hundred miles per hour.
The new Iranian submarines may not be the most advanced, but they could still prove dangerous adversaries in the confined and shallow waters of the Persian Gulf.
0d2186b1907f1cbc76abc25fddeb93f1:
Iran has developed Bavar-2 flying boats, also known as Ground Effect Vehicles (GEVs), for its asymmetric naval strategy.
The Bavar-2 GEVs are small, one- or two-man boats designed for scouting purposes.
The Bavar-2 GEVs can skim meters above the surface at around 100 knots (115 miles per hour) and are equipped with night-vision goggles, cameras, and real-time datalinks.
The Bavar-2 GEVs are not intended to strike the enemy directly but would enable Iran to shut down the Strait of Hormuz in the event of a new conflict in the Persian Gulf.
The Bavar-2 GEVs would skim ahead of Iranian missile boats, acquire targeting data on enemy warships, and relay that information to the missile boats.
Iran has also developed a new, eight-meter-long twin-engine GEV flying boat and an unmanned GEV drone.
China and Russia are also considering new GEV designs.
54260c433a57104b2c078032fcc3dc87:
Iran's expanding unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) program poses a growing threat to countries in the Middle East, including Saudi Arabia, and the West.
Iran's UAV program includes eight production and assembly sites across the country, receiving parts and materials from foreign sources.
Iran has used UAVs to attack Western targets in conflict zones like Syria and Iraq, as well as targets in Lebanon and Saudi Arabia.
Iran supplies the Houthi militia in Yemen with drones, which are assembled in Yemen and have components from outside Iran.
Iran's UAV program aims to destabilize the region and create chaos, with eight industries involved in disguising the production of weaponized drones.
Iran's multibillion-dollar UAV program, directed by the Quds Force of the Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps, is described as "the regime's primary weapon for terrorism."
Iran's UAV program has expanded due to "counterproductive" negotiations with Western nations about lifting sanctions.
The NCRI presented satellite images, graphs, and charts revealing the complexity and "alarming new details" of Iran's UAV terror program, gathered by the opposition group Mujahedin-e Khalq.
120e209d52994fc0484484b0c284d16f:
Iranian dissidents warn of the hard-line regime’s use of drones to cause instability in the region.
The National Council of Resistance of Iran (NCRI) released evidence in a press conference showing the production and utilization of unmanned aerial vehicles (UACs) for terrorist operations and for assisting its proxies in the Middle East.
The NCRI alleges that the regime has used a web of industries to spend billions of dollars to produce components or smuggle them in from foreign countries, including China.
The NCRI report alleges that at least one of the operations, Ghazanfar Roknabadi Industries, provides support and training for International Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) factories and uses raw materials that are imported from China.
The findings by the group also show that a new drone complex, with a specialized drone unit, has been set up in Semnan since 2019.
The NCRI identifies eight alleged UAV manufacturing bases and seven more for maintenance and other services.
The Quds forces is working to make sure that the drone program equips proxies in the region, including in Yemen, Syria and Lebanon, with the advanced technology.
The NCRI calls on countries not to lift any further sanctions on the regime until it stops its aggressive behavior.
The Biden administration has indicated it wishes to rejoin the controversial 2015 Iran nuclear deal, but talks have been stalled since June.
20b7d2756ddc199af44ea0a40f7d7c3e: Iran started a two-day air defense drill in the central desert of the country.
The drill is the latest show of force by Iran.
9b4bd51b419922fd5c8d675cf300017d:
The commander of Iran’s Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) says the Guards’ naval forces have reached the “quick reaction” capability in the face of any threat.
The IRGC Navy has been able to gain complete control over the geography of the Persian Gulf and the Strait of Hormuz using modern electronic warfare systems.
The IRGC Navy has achieved remarkable progress in producing state-of-the-art vessels, long-range drones and sea-based guided missiles in the last three years.
The IRGC Navy fully monitors the movements of every vessel that enters or exits the strategic Strait of Hormuz.
The IRGC Navy is at its maximum readiness and is able to respond quickly and decisively to any threat.
All the hardware employed by the IRGC Navy are fully produced domestically.
de6cc904bc87d59fea7dfe98790a2264:
Chief Commander of Iran's Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) Major General Hossein Salami announced that the naval units of his forces will be armed with cruise missiles with an operational range of up to 2,000 kilometers and capable of targeting moving vessels in the near future.
The IRGC navy has made considerable progress in development and manufacture of unmanned aerial vehicles, and now possesses hundreds of reconnaissance, surveillance, combat and kamikaze drones with different operational ranges of up to 1,200 kilometers (745 miles).
The IRGC navy also currently has missiles with various ranges of 35, 90, 300 and 700 kilometers in its inventory.
The IRGC navy has developed various signal collection systems, jammers and electronic warfare systems, and that the hardware expanded both defensive and offensive capabilities of the force.
Commander of the Valiasr Drone Unit of the Army, Brigadier General Shahram Hassannejad, praised the homegrown technology of Iranian drones, stating that such a feature has eased their design, production, application and overhaul.
Iranian drones have also been designed and built in accordance with climate and strategic characteristics of their operational zones.
The US Central Command (CENTCOM) has acknowledged the aerial superiority of Iran in the region due to its large fleet of combat drones.
bb2d32d58d95d55235d9bb956938105c:
Iran has launched multiple waves of attacks using loitering munitions, a type of unmanned aerial vehicle, against civilian facilities in the Arabian Peninsula.
Iran has provided the know-how and components to use the technology to its political pawn in Yemen, the Houthis, leading to a spike in drone attacks throughout the Middle East.
The drones are relatively cheap to manufacture and can be difficult to defend against, particularly the loitering "suicide" munitions that have been used with increasing frequency by Iran and its proxies against Arab, American and Israeli interests across the Middle East.
Iran is leveraging drone strikes by its extremist proxies to strengthen its position in the region, and a coordinated response by regional allies is needed to prevent further attacks.
Iran's use of proxies, such as the Houthis and Iraqi Shiite militia groups, to launch drone strikes gives it a measure of plausible deniability.
Iran has been able to circumvent global sanctions to acquire the necessary components and technology to mass-produce explosives-laden UAVs.
Without a comprehensive regional strategy that employs a more active posture to deter and weaken Iran's combat-drone capabilities, Tehran and its transnational network of militant groups is likely to conclude that the benefits outweigh the cost of escalating attacks.
The response to Iran's growing threat should be proactive, collective, and multi-layered, including intelligence efforts to block foreign components smuggled into Iran, developing dynamic and cost-efficient technological solutions, and targeting drone shipments before reaching Iran's armed militias.
The mastermind behind Tehran's drone program, Brig. Gen. Saeed Aghajani, was personally responsible for orchestrating the 2019 attacks on Saudi oil facilities.
Washington is unlikely to embark on a more proactive policy that would raise the stakes for Iran and its proxies, as the Biden administration has already lifted sanctions on a number of figures linked to Iran's ballistic missiles program and signaled its willingness to restart negotiations on the Iran nuclear deal.
Iran feels emboldened enough to launch drone strikes against oil tankers, international airports and other civilian targets, despite an array of sanctions designed to prevent them and their proxies developing such capabilities.
Neutralizing the strategic threat posed by the Iranian network of proxy-enabled drone strikes will probably require a measure of cooperation and knowledge-sharing by states in the region that have found themselves in the crosshairs of Iran's proxy militant groups.
b6977f94dfd7fa49b68fa194976c7df8:
The Islamic Republic of Iran Air Force (IRIAF) will hold large-scale and nationwide drills, codenamed Fada’eeyan-e Harim-e Velayat (Devotees of the Velayat Sanctuary), on Thursday.
A wide range of aircraft and drones, including dozens of fighter jets, bombers, military transport aircraft, and reconnaissance aircraft, will be employed in the drills.
The drilling squadrons will be flying Sukhoi Su-24 attack aircraft, long-range supersonic F-4 fighter bombers, F-5 fighter aircraft, F-7 fighter jets, RF-4 fighter bombers, Mikoyan MiG-29 fighter jets, F-14 Tomcat fighter aircraft, as well as indigenously-developed Sa’eqeh (Lightning) fighters during the exercise.
The aerial maneuvers will be backed by Boeing-707 and -747 aerial refueling airplanes, transport and freight aircraft, in addition to homegrown Karrar (Striker), Kian, Ababil (Bird Flock), Arash, and Kaman-12 (Bow-12) unmanned aerial vehicles that are equipped with rockets, precision-guided missiles, long-range smart bombs and radar jamming devices.
The military hardware have been deployed to five bases across the country, including Shahid Babaei Airbase in the central Isfahan Province and Shahid Fakouri Airbase in the northwestern province of East Azarbaijan Province.
The maneuvers are aimed at “assessment of combat capabilities of IRIAF units, increasing preparedness of interceptors, practicing the implementation of reconnaissance and operational plans, and establishment of a right model that would suit real-life battle.”
Long-range endurance of the Islamic Republic of Iran Air Force fighter jets outside their defensive spheres, pinpoint accuracy of bombs and rockets in air-to-surface strikes as well as surveillance of the operational zone will be put to test during the massive drills.
Air-to-air missiles will be fired to test their high destructive power.
All kinds of homegrown and upgraded systems and ammunition, including heavy and semi-heavy smart bombs, plus all kinds of laser-guided, thermal and radar-evading missiles will be used during the exercise.
Fada’eeyan-e Harim-e Velayat-10 aerial drills will be commanded by the IRIAF Command Center in Tehran, using sophisticated, multi-layered and secure communication systems.
09b4a2c5acbb90d4e54f7734f550fda0: After 2 years, Israel Air Force (IAF) resumes exercises in preparation for a possible attack on Iran's nuclear program.
c93f98261edcb509116fb8f0a14a3a28:
Iran is accused by the United States of testing rockets near an American aircraft carrier in the Persian Gulf.
Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) naval vessels conducted live-fire drills less than 1,500 yards away from the USS Harry S. Truman, USS Bulkeley, and FS Provence.
The Straits of Hormuz are a narrow channel that is an ideal point for Iran to attempt to block access to the Persian Gulf.
Iran's most effective and proven weapon to cut off the Straits of Hormuz are likely to be sea mines.
Sea mines have sunk or disabled the majority of the nineteen U.S. Navy vessels lost since World War II.
a99c6b6fe98bbb15a1467c1902f8ca6c:
On May 10, Iranian small boats harassed and tried to intimidate a group of U.S. Navy ships as they transited the Strait of Hormuz.
The U.S. warships fired warning shots to diffuse the situation.
The Iranian boats approached at high speeds with their weapons uncovered and manned.
The Iranian boats closed within 150 yards of the U.S. Coast Guard Cutter Maui.
The Navy report referred to the Iranian actions as “unsafe and unprofessional.”
The Iranian small boat actions may have been part of a serious attack contingency.
Iranian small boats packed with explosives could present a serious threat to a large surface ship.
U.S. Navy warships could be armed with Close-in-Weapons-Systems (CIWS) phalanx guns to defend against small boat attacks.
The group of Navy ships only included one navy cruiser along with several U.S. Navy and U.S. Coast Guard Patrol Boats.
Most of the smaller Navy and Coast Guard patrol ships do not have CIWS.
8a031297fc855cbc485cdc233f99bded:
The AIM-54 Phoenix is one of the most powerful air-to-air missiles ever to exist.
The only country successfully to wield the AIM-54 in combat has been Iran, which acquired 79 F-14s and hundreds of Phoenixes from the United States in the early 1970s.
Iranian Tomcats fired many AIM-54s at Iraqi planes during the eight-year Iran-Iraq war that began on Sept. 22, 1980.
On Sept. 9, 1980, Iranian Tomcat pilot Mohammed-Reza Ataayee and a wingman were protecting a formation of F-4Es bombing Iraqi positions near the border.
Ataayee and his wingman launched an AIM-54 at an Iraqi aircraft and saw the target disappear from their radar.
The Iranian air force officially credited Ataayee with a kill of an Iraqi Sukhoi Su-20M flown by pilot named Faysal Abdul-Fattah Abdul Rahman.
It remains unknown if Ataayee and Pasha-Pour really scored the first-ever kill by an AIM-54.
bbb4a394833d69a78eb7235969d3b5b7:
Israeli F-15 fighter jets escorted an American B-1B bomber through the region as it made its way to the Persian Gulf on Saturday.
The escort mission came as Israeli and American officials have increasingly threatened to act against Tehran’s nuclear program.
Israeli officials have explicitly threatened a military strike on Iran’s nuclear program, while Americans have discussed the matter more circumspectly.
In the beginning of this year, IDF Chief of Staff Aviv Kohavi announced he had instructed the military to begin drawing up fresh attack plans for such an operation.
Israeli Air Force plans to begin simulating strikes on Iran’s nuclear facilities in the coming months.
Israel has twice conducted airstrikes on enemy nations’ nuclear programs, bombing Iraq’s nuclear reactor in 1981 and Syria’s in 2007.
d941679a01ec95d623409db605eee406:
The U.S. Air Force flew a B-1B strategic bomber with Israel over the Middle East above essential maritime chokepoints on Saturday.
The aircraft flew over the Strait of Hormuz, the Red Sea, the Bab el-Mandeb Strait and the Suez Canal in Egypt.
Bahrain, Egypt, Saudi Arabia and Israel also flew fighter jets alongside the U.S. bomber.
The flyover was “designed to send a clear message of reassurance across the region.”
The Strait of Hormuz and the Red Sea have been the scene of attacks on shipping in recent years, later blamed on Iran.
Iran has said it did not play a role in the attacks, but the country has said it will retaliate against Israel for attacking its nuclear program.
The U.S. under the Trump administration had reportedly deployed flights by nuclear-capable B-52 bombers in an effort to represent a show of force to Iran.
Iran’s Deputy Foreign Minister Ali Bagheri announced last week that Iran will return to negotiations to resurrect the 2015 nuclear deal by the end of next month.
Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the U.S. and other countries are looking into “other options” to prepare for a situation where Iran is not prepared to negotiate in good faith.
f30c3ed2cd82d784d123d07c99855a2f:
Saudi fighter jets escorted a US Air Force B-1B Lancer strategic bomber in a “show of strength” over key waterways in the Middle East, including the Arabian Gulf, the Bab Al-Mandeb strait, the Suez Canal, the Gulf of Oman, and the Strait of Hormuz.
Military aircraft from Egypt, Bahrain, and Israel also accompanied the B-1B Lancer.
The mission was intended to deliver a clear message of reassurance and demonstrate military readiness for any contingency or mission.
The B-1B Lancer is a supersonic bomber that can carry the heaviest conventional payload of all the US military’s planes.
The regional patrol is Centcom's fifth such operation this year.
Talks aimed at reviving the 2015 deal to limit Iran’s nuclear program have stalled.
US President Joe Biden has offered to return to the nuclear accord, but his administration has voiced growing frustration over delays after a hard-line government took office in Iran.
338449c37b6109d3ba256920794b7d21:
Israeli F-15 fighter jets escorted an American B-1 strategic heavy bomber through Israel's airspace.
The joint flight illustrates the continued strategic cooperation of the IDF with the United States in the area.
Israeli officials have repeatedly threatened to act against Tehran’s nuclear program.
President Biden has expressed interest in returning the US to the deal with Iran since his inauguration in January.
The talks were further delayed in June by Iran’s presidential election and the formation of a new government.
Iran said it would return to negotiations by the end of November.
US President Joe Biden, UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson, French President Emmanuel Macron, and German Chancellor Angela Merkel put more pressure on Iran’s new president, Ebrahim Rais, warning the world of “the risks posed to international security by Iran’s escalating nuclear program.”
49a308a5f363ac0dcd5d976fccbb12ca:
A US Air Force B-1B Lancer bomber escorted by fighter jets from Israel, Saudi Arabia, Bahrain and Egypt flew over key waterways in the Middle East, including the Gulf, Bab al-Mandeb Strait, Suez Canal, Gulf of Oman and Strait of Hormuz.
The bomber task force mission was intended to deliver a clear message of reassurance, according to the US Central Command.
The regional patrol is Centcom’s fifth such operation this year.
Talks aimed at reviving the 2015 deal to limit Iran’s nuclear program have stalled.
An Iranian general has said Israel and the United States were likely to have been behind a cyber attack that interrupted the distribution of fuel at service stations in Iran.
The cyber attack caused traffic jams on major arteries in Tehran, where long queues at petrol stations disrupted the flow of traffic.
ad09b5909954cb61af426a983fb0a9c6:
Air Force B-1 bombers have gone to India and Norway as part of the service’s massively stepped-up Bomber Task Force (BTF) global operations.
Bomber Task Forces are expanding in size, scope and frequency, often extending to less visited parts of the globe such as the Arctic and parts of Western Asia.
B-1 bombers in Norway introduce new patrol opportunities to show force and presence in the Arctic region which is increasingly contested by major power rivals.
The U.S. Central Command just sent two B-52H Stratofortress bombers flying through vital parts of the Middle East in what is seen as a warning message to Iran.
The B-52 is being re-engineered and new radar and cruise missiles are being added to the platform, such as the emerging Air Launched Rapid Response (ARRW) hypersonic weapon.
Precision targeting, a new generation of networking technologies and upgraded weapons systems also bring new opportunities for deterrence.
1c6afa49482be8f301f0015495cfb302:
A Chinese admiral and pundit, Rear Adm. Lou Yuan, threatened to sink two U.S. Navy aircraft carriers and kill thousands of American sailors to resolve China's territorial disputes.
The Chinese military has deployed an array of weaponry specifically to target American flattops.
A U.S. Navy test in 2005 proved that even if hit, carriers are really hard to sink.
The last time anyone permanently sank a U.S. Navy aircraft carrier in combat was during World War II.
To even try to sink an American flattop, you first must hit it, which is not easy due to the air wing, escorting destroyers, cruisers, and submarines that surround the carrier.
China or another country could attempt to target the carriers with submarines, cruise missiles, and ballistic rockets.
Shooting anything at an aircraft carrier is a costly, difficult operation, and the carrier's attackers could face withering counterfire from the vessel's defenders.
If a country were to sink an American carrier, the United States would likely deploy all its remaining military might, including its surviving eight or nine carriers, against the country behind the sinking.
987ed2e21432e308cf4452db33397f65:
Iran's military will begin a large-scale exercise in the Gulf of Oman, the northern part of the Indian Ocean, and in sections of the Red Sea on Sunday.
The drill, dubbed “Zolfaqar-1400,” will involve forces from the Iranian Army Ground Forces, Navy, Air Force, and Air Defense units.
The drill will cover an area of over one million square kilometers (386,102 square miles) southeast of Iran, stretching from the eastern side of the Strait of Hormuz to the northern part of the Indian Ocean, as well as part of the Red Sea.
Locally-produced equipment and ammunition, including “advanced reconnaissance and combat drones with various ranges,” will be used in the drill.
The drill is also aimed at raising the combat and defense capabilities of the various units “for protecting the country’s territorial integrity.”
Iran regularly holds such drills and says they assess the troops’ combat readiness and demonstrate the nation’s military capabilities.
The region remains on edge over Iran’s escalating nuclear program.
Nuclear negotiations between Iran and world powers are to resume on November 29.
Iran has breached limits set by the nuclear deal and is enriching small amounts of uranium to its closest-ever levels to weapons-grade purity as its stockpile continues to grow.
Iran claims its nuclear program is only for peaceful purposes.
527a73fabbc634c9ea479cde3f29da6d:
Iran announced a large-scale military exercise in the Arabian and Red seas, called Zolfaqar-1400, starting on Sunday.
The exercise will cover an area of over one million square kilometers southeast of Iran, from the Strait of Hormuz to the Indian Ocean and parts of the Red Sea.
The exercise will involve the Army Ground Force, Navy, Air Force, and Air Defense.
The announcement comes after Iran accused the US of attacking an Iranian oil tanker in the Gulf of Oman on 3 November.
The US has denied the accusations, saying they are "absolutely totally false and untrue."
57680aa70185b94b4c0c3f9a279ed5c0:
Iran has launched comprehensive war games involving missiles, torpedoes, and drones to deter potential threats.
The Zolfaqar exercise includes the firing of Qader, Qadir, and Nasr anti-ship missiles, as well as anti-aircraft systems like the 15-Khordad and Mersad.
Submarines IRIS Tariq and IRIS Qadir fired Valfajr torpedoes at mock targets.
Iran employed suicide drones, including the Arash, to take out simulated enemies.
Major General Gholam-Ali Rashid stated the maneuvers aim to preserve Iran's territorial integrity and counter threats from the United States and Israel.
The drills began a day after the U.S. Navy conducted a missile exercise in the Persian Gulf.
The U.S. exercise involved coastal patrol ships and a guided-missile destroyer.
Tensions remain high in the region following an assassination attempt on Iraqi Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi.
Iran's Revolutionary Guard released footage of a tense encounter with the U.S. 5th Fleet over an oil tanker.
The U.S. and Iran are set to resume nuclear deal negotiations in Vienna on November 29.
Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesperson Saeed Khatibzadeh accused the Biden administration of failing to lift sanctions and return to the nuclear deal.
U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken expressed concerns about Iran's destabilizing influence, including its support for terrorism and ballistic missile program.
3821670c43075099a388350c7cda7a21:
Satellite images show China has built mock-ups of US ships on a military firing range in Ruoqiang, Xinjiang.
The mock-ups include an aircraft carrier and destroyers, suggesting they will be used for target practice.
China has been rapidly expanding its military, including developing new weapons and increasing its armed forces.
Beijing and Washington are at loggerheads over Taiwan, with tensions also growing in the South China Sea.
The US Defense Department estimates that China's navy will grow to 460 ships by 2030.
China also possesses the world's largest standing army and the third-largest air force.
General Mark Milley, chairman of the joint chiefs of staff, said China is "challenging us regionally" and "wants to revise the international order to their advantage."
Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said he had no information about the images.
fe22ce97dad4b149e872facbc378656d:
Iranian Army warned off US drones trying to approach Iranian war games near the mouth of the Gulf.
The annual Iranian military exercises concluded on Tuesday, a few weeks before resumption of talks between Tehran and world powers to revive a 2015 nuclear deal.
The exercises stretched from the east of the Strait of Hormuz to the north of the Indian Ocean and parts of the Red Sea.
About a fifth of oil that is consumed globally passes through the strategic Strait of Hormuz waterway in the Gulf.
Indirect talks between Iran and US President Joe Biden’s administration to revive the pact are set to resume in Vienna on Nov. 29.
e0283a3d822ec6ab525ae13cd0a00ce2:
China has built a mock-up of a Ford-class aircraft carrier, two Arleigh-Burke-class guided-missile destroyers, and other carrier-shaped targets in the Taklamakan desert in western Xinjiang Province.
The mock-ups are likely intended for target practice for China's growing arsenal of anti-ship ballistic missiles (ASBMs).
ASBMs have never been used in combat before, and there is debate over their reliability in hitting moving targets.
China has previously tested ASBMs against a carrier-like target in 2013 and successfully test-fired DF-21D and DF-26B missiles at moving maritime targets near the Paracel Islands in 2019.
China's return to land-based ASBM target tests is likely intended to limit the controversy and observability of tests in the open commons of the Pacific Ocean.
The land-based tests may also prove less expensive or logistically complicated to orchestrate, and the smaller rail-based target may allow missile units to repeatedly practice striking a moving target.
China has been expanding and enhancing its maritime surveillance capabilities with radars deployed on a network of artificial islands, additional satellites launched into space, and new types of robotic spy submarines, surveillance drones, and maritime patrol aircraft.
Practice against realistic and moving target tests, and forming spotter-shooter kill chains seem like necessary prerequisites before simulating more complex tactics used in combat scenarios against a reactive enemy with air defenses.
dbe3d15d622c2d68dfb39316a9f80693:
Iran's military claimed to intercept and destroy two American unmanned aircraft during a massive military drill.
Iran monitored two US drone aircraft entering the airspace over Iranian waters.
Iran identified the drone aircraft as model MQ-9 and RQ-4 drones.
The shoot-downs came just after Iran said its massive military drills around the Straits of Hormuz were "a serious warning to our enemies".
In 2020, Iran also claimed to intercept two US drone aircraft during military drills.
7a407109c00dde48f2a1f3a9a4d54fba:
Iran has unveiled a new "state of the art" fighter jet called the Kowsar, which appears identical to an F-5F Tiger II two-seater jet.
The Kowsar may merely be an avionics testbed, a regular F-5F fitted with new avionics intended for use in the Saeqeh fighter.
The actual Kowsar-88, which is a different airplane and is much shorter, is not yet ready.
Iran plans to acquire additional J85 engines on the black market or cannibalize the parts from older F-5A and B model aircraft.
Iran will attempt to procure Russian Yak-130 or Chinese JL-10 (aka L-15 Falcon) supersonic trainers.
The Kowsar program reflects Tehran's plans to shore up fighter pilot training and sustain the number of operational airframes.
The unveiling of the not-Kowsar fighter illustrates the casual dishonesty of Tehran's propagandists.
95712899506f41ca2ea9a9ac5089afc9:
Iran claims its military warned off U.S. drones (RQ-4 and MQ-9) that approached during its annual war games exercises.
U.S. Army Maj. John Rigsbee, a spokesperson for Centcom, said the U.S. is not seeing operation reports that suggest the Iranian military has prevented U.S. forces from fulfilling its objectives in the region.
Iran and the U.S. are set to resume talks to reenter the 2015 Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA) nuclear deal.
The U.S. will directly participate in the talks, which will be the first regarding reentering the nuclear deal since former President Trump exited from it in 2018.
The six rounds of indirect negotiations that occurred earlier this year ended in June when Iran elected a new president.
State Department spokesperson Ned Price said the U.S.’s strategy in the talks will not change.
97e4fdf5a5e82df1ae3f1d9eaf3f6c1f:
Iran claimed to have fended off two American drones trying to approach the site of a major Iranian military drill in the Gulf.
Iran concluded its annual war games in a coastal area of the Gulf of Oman on Tuesday.
The war games are aimed at “improving readiness in confronting foreign threats and any possible invasion.”
Iranian media said navy and air force units, as well as ground forces, participated in an area of more than 1 million square kilometers (386,100 square miles), east of the strategic Strait of Hormuz.
The development comes amid heightened tensions between Iran and the US in the wake of former president Donald Trump’s unilateral withdrawal from Iran’s 2015 nuclear deal with world powers.
Iran says its stockpile of 20% enriched uranium has reached over 210 kilograms (463 pounds), the latest defiant move ahead of upcoming nuclear talks with the West.
After months of delays, the European Union, Iran and the US announced last week that indirect talks to resuscitate the deal would resume November 29 in Vienna.
7a5c3be0bdcba5428c395f13727fe317:
Iran's military intercepted two US drones, a General Atomics MQ-9 Reaper and Northrop Grumman RQ-4 Global Hawk, during the Zolfaqar-1400 drills.
The drones flew into Iran's Flight Information Region and Air Defence Identification Zone near the country's southeastern coastal and sea areas.
The military believes the drones intended to gather intelligence on the Zolfaqar-1400 drills, which covered over a million square kilometres and involved units from the army, Navy, Air Force, and Air Defence troops.
Iran has previously shot down a US RQ-4 Global Hawk drone in 2019 and a US RQ-170 drone in 2011.
Yemen's Houthi militia also shot down two US Reaper drones in 2019.
919835e36cf837565cbe128ce1bc9f34:
Iranian Army intercepted two US unmanned aerial vehicles that had penetrated into Iran's airspace.
The American aircraft, including General Atomics MQ-9 Reaper and Northrop Grumman RQ-4 Global Hawk drones, intruded into Iran's Flight Information Region (FIR) and Air Defense Identification Zone (ADIZ).
The Iranian integrated air defense network monitored the American drones and warned them off by the Islamic Republic of Iran Air Defense Force.
Forces from the Army Ground Force, Navy, Air Force, and Air Defense have taken part in Zolfaqar-1400 war game that covers an area stretching from the eastern sector of the strategic Strait of Hormuz to the northern tip of the Indian Ocean.
The Iranian Navy’s offshore units flew the homegrown and radar-evading Omid drone to jam the radars of the mock enemy stationed on the coast.
Iranian military experts and technicians have made great progress in developing and manufacturing a broad range of military equipment.
Iranian officials have repeatedly underscored that the Islamic Republic will not hesitate to build up its defense capabilities, emphasizing such abilities are entirely meant for the purpose of defense and will be never subject to negotiations.
fa5ce4d8ac1f53da9bb3b02248d6da09:
Iranian army intercepted two U.S. drones during the Zolfaqar-1400 military drills.
The U.S. drones, including MQ-9 and RQ-4, intruded into Iran's Flight Information Region and Air Defence Identification Zone.
The drones were approaching to gather intelligence but changed their course and flew away after receiving decisive warnings from the Iranian army.
The Iranian army launched a large-scale military exercise on the southern coasts, east of the Strait of Hormuz.
The two-day joint exercise was wrapped up with a naval parade.
Iranian army commanders said the drills aimed at enhancing preparations to ward off threats and sending a message of peace and friendship to regional states.
b07ac5bd2b15f1d1166f61899cb76d13:
Iranian state media claimed that the Iran military had “warned off” U.S. drones that were operating near an annual exercise at the mouth of the Persian Gulf.
The annual Zulfiqar 1400 exercises began on Sunday, east of the Strait of Hormuz, and extended over an area of more than a million square kilometers (around 400,000 square miles) in the Sea of Oman, the Indian Ocean and even into parts of the Red Sea.
The war games concluded on Tuesday with a parade of warships that included Iranian submarines.
The U.S. military operates roughly forty-nine of the RQ-4 Global Hawks and nearly two hundred of the MQ-9 Reaper unmanned aircraft.
This latest incident between Tehran and Washington comes just weeks before the two countries are set to resume talks to restart the 2015 Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action nuclear deal.
The next round of talks is set to resume in Vienna on November 29.
d8ec071d7befa6355bb8a799d08d4524:
North Korea developed the Type 73 machine gun in the 1970s, but it was not widely used in North Korea.
Iran imported a large number of Type 73s during the Iran-Iraq War in the 1980s.
Iran has since made improvements to the Type 73 and built copies of it.
Iran has shipped copies of the Type 73 to militant groups in the Middle East, including in Libya, Syria, Iraq, and Yemen.
Western forces have intercepted ships hauling illicit cargoes comprising Type 73s on several occasions in recent years.
The Type 73 has been documented in the hands of several Iran-backed militant groups, including the Badr Brigade, Al-Imam Ali Brigade, and Christian Babylon Brigades.
The Type 73 has also been documented in the hands of the Syrian Arab Army and Houthi fighters in Yemen.
The Type 73 is popular with militant groups because it uses the same cartridges and ammunition belts as the more common PKM machine gun.
d6c8ef2fa7a9050eb19de89f4ccae35f:
Israeli F-15 fighter jets escorted United States B-1 bombers through the region for the second time in a month, in a tacit threat to Iran.
The joint flight included two B-1B heavy bombers and an American KC-10 refueling jet through Israeli airspace as they headed west from the Persian Gulf.
The escort missions come as Israeli and American officials have increasingly threatened to act against Tehran’s nuclear program, ahead of the resumption of indirect talks with Iran aimed at reviving the 2015 nuclear deal.
The navies of Israel, the United States, the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain announced that they had launched a joint exercise in the Red Sea, in another apparent threat to their shared adversary, Iran.
Israeli officials have explicitly threatened a military strike on Iran’s nuclear program, while Americans have discussed the matter more circumspectly, referring to “other options” beyond diplomatic negotiations in order to halt Tehran’s atomic aspirations.
The Israeli Air Force plans to begin simulating strikes on Iran’s nuclear facilities in the coming months.
Israel has twice conducted airstrikes on enemy nations’ nuclear programs, bombing Iraq’s nuclear reactor in 1981 and Syria’s in 2007.
0f361c8cb6d25fcc7ccc96cd53a9cc25:
Egypt’s Speaker of the House Hanafy Gebaly and his South Korean counterpart Park Byeong-Seug met on Monday to discuss the establishment of a parliamentary friendship association between the two countries.
The current visit of the speaker of South Korea’s National Assembly to Egypt reflects the growing bilateral relations between Cairo and Seoul.
Egypt and South Korea have friendly relations and the leaders of the two countries are keen to push these relations forward at all levels.
Egypt and South Korea are currently in the process of setting up an Egypt-South Korea Parliamentary Friendship Association to strengthen cooperation between the two countries at the political, economic, and parliamentary levels.
The relations between Egypt and South Korea are historical.
The visit of the speaker of South Korea’s National Assembly to Cairo is an extension of these historic relations and aims to boost the comprehensive partnership between Egypt and South Korea in all areas.
41a98f62e089c902d4e4cc5b7e1c1a92:
Hungary's President János Áder expressed Hungary's keenness to support Egypt's developmental efforts in a meeting with President Abdel-Fattah El-Sisi in Budapest on Tuesday.
El-Sisi has been on an official visit to the Hungarian capital since Monday, when he attended a summit for the Visegrád Group in which he tackled Egypt’s efforts to fight terrorism and block illegal immigration to Europe.
Áder expressed during his meeting with El-Sisi following the summit his country’s keenness to extend its support to Egypt in all fields by exchanging expertise and fostering joint investments.
El-Sisi said that Hungarian investments and industries currently have an opportunity to enter the Egyptian market and enjoy the country’s modern infrastructure and its access to African markets.
The two leaders also discussed a number of regional and international issues of mutual concern, especially the developments in Libya, Afghanistan, as well as joint efforts to face the repercussions of the coronavirus pandemic.
Áder hailed Egypt’s role in consolidating stability in the Middle East and Africa as well as its efforts to combat illegal immigration, ensure co-existence among religions, and back peaceful solutions to the region’s crises.
The Hungarian president stressed that his country fully understands the Egyptian stance towards the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam (GERD) and the importance of the River Nile’s water to Egypt, affirming that settling the GERD dispute should enhance stability in the entire region.
Egypt, Sudan, and Ethiopia recently expressed their readiness to engage in the African Union-sponsored negotiations to resolve their decade-long dispute over the mega dam Addis Ababa is building on the Blue Nile.
El-Sisi reiterated on Tuesday Egypt’s stance on the need to reach a legally binding agreement that regulates the filling and operation of the dam based on international law and the UN Security Council’s presidential statement, which was issued in mid-September, encouraging the three sides to return to the negotiation table of the AU.
The two leaders also hailed the ongoing level of cooperation and coordination between Egypt and Hungary in the management of water resources, especially water treatment plants.
Áder also lauded Egypt’s recent steps regarding the Israeli-Palestinian peace process, which led to consolidating calm between the Israeli and Palestinian sides and improving the Palestinians’ humanitarian conditions.
Egypt, through diplomatic efforts, has urged the revival of the peace process between the Israeli and Palestinian sides to ensure Palestinians’ legitimate rights, ease regional tensions, and achieve stability in the Middle East.
Such efforts included a meeting between El-Sisi and Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett last month in Egypt, marking the first time an Israeli PM has made a visit to Egypt in a decade.
Additionally, in May, Egypt sponsored a ceasefire deal between Israel and Palestinian factions within the Gaza Strip to end an 11-day episode of Israeli military aggression on Gaza, during which more than 250 Palestinians, including 66 children, were killed.
Egypt also pledged $500 million for the reconstruction of Gaza in the aftermath of the Israeli attacks.
8ecf23c05ebbf975779e8358e0e07b13:
Hala Zayed, Egypt’s minister of health and population, handed over the presidency of the 68th session of the World Health Organization’s Regional Committee for the Eastern Mediterranean to her Libyan counterpart Ali Mohamed Miftah Al-Zanati.
The handover came at the end of Zayed’s presidency with the approval of the committee’s members.
During her speech, Zayed highlighted the region’s commitment to continue providing humanitarian aid to Afghanistan.
The region is committed to launching a polio eradication strategy for the period 2022-2026.
245d1ab1ea71f9614daba80780bbcf36:
Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah al-Sisi and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson discussed promoting bilateral ties, especially in defence, security and anti-terrorism fields.
Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah al-Sisi and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson discussed reviving tourist flows from the United Kingdom (UK) to Egypt.
Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah al-Sisi and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson discussed regional issues of common interest, Libya in particular, and agreed on boosting the ongoing political path, until achieving the aspired elections by end of the year.
Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah al-Sisi and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson stressed the importance of the exiting of all foreign forces from Libya.
Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah al-Sisi and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson discussed the latest developments of the controversial issue of the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam (GERD).
Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah al-Sisi stressed the importance of reaching a fair, legal and balanced deal over the operation and filling of the GERD, in a way that preserves Egypt’s share of the Nile River and rights of the other parties, as well as, maintaining regional stability.
a431e43d80e5ce610974cbb4271dcf98:
The European Union aims to approve a new partnership document with Cairo during the upcoming Egypt-EU Association Council's ministerial meetings.
The new priorities in the partnership document include responses to the coronavirus pandemic, health and vaccines production files, as well as social and green files.
The European Union and the Egyptian Ministry of Energy and Renewable Energy are working to update an energy strategy to focus on renewable, wind, solar and hydrogen energies.
New priority areas also include the economy's digitisation and various artificial intelligence domains.
EU Special Representative for the Horn of Africa Annette Weber will visit Cairo within weeks to hold talks with Egyptian officials regarding the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam.
EU Commissioner for Neighborhood Policy and Enlargement Oliver Varheli will visit Egypt by the end of October to discuss investment issues before the launch of the EU's new investment plan for the southern neighbourhood in February 2022.
Egypt enjoys several advantages in the investment field, especially when it comes to infrastructure, transportation, ease of exporting products and new legislation.
Renewable energy is a promising sector for investment where Egypt already possesses huge potentials.
The European Union welcomes Egypt's new human rights strategy and is ready to share its experience in translating its various axes into legislation.
5a00ce58311da4cac501d1e89f7dc0ae:
Egypt’s Environment Minister Yasmine Fouad and Saudi counterpart Abdulrahman Al-Fadley discussed environmental cooperation between Egypt and Saudi Arabia.
Fouad and Al-Fadley praised their countries’ successful cooperation in the field of environmental protection.
Fouad welcomed cooperation with Saudi Arabia in terms of converting waste into energy.
The two sides discussed cooperation in the fields of coastal management, marine policies, environmental monitoring, management of chemicals and hazardous waste, and integration of environmental knowledge into educational curricula.
Al-Fadley expressed his aspiration to cooperate with Egypt in the field of water desalination and reusing extracted salt.
The two sides agreed to focus on cooperating to preserve the Red Sea, with Fouad noting its richness in coral reefs and marine life.
73914504813d80a867643f7125e2e54e:
Egyptian Foreign Minister and UK Minister for the Middle East and North Africa James Cleverly welcomed recent progress in bilateral relations since the Egypt-UK free trade agreement went into force earlier this year.
The UK removed Egypt from a travel red list, which imposes a mandatory 10-day quarantine at a hotel on visitors from Egypt to the kingdom due to coronavirus concerns.
The free trade agreement, known as the association deal, was signed between Egypt and the UK in December 2020 to provide a platform to deepen trade and investment relations between the two countries after Brexit.
Egypt expressed support for the efforts made by the UK to make the 2021 United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP27) successful.
Egypt is hoping the conference's outcomes will push forward efforts to combat climate change, most significantly providing support to developing countries under the 2016 Paris agreement.
Egypt has been selected as a nominee to host the UN Climate Change Conference COP 27, scheduled for November 2022.
Shoukry and Cleverly also exchanged views regarding several regional issues, at the top of which is the situation in Palestine and the peace process, as well as the developments in Libya, Syria and Lebanon.
8f9ba5dadb6fc130c18a4e4c3fcf3bb6:
Minister of Health Hala Zayed will witness the inauguration of the AFri Egypt Medical Centre in Jinja, Uganda on Monday.
The centre was established by a consortium of Egyptian private and state-owned drug manufacturers.
Egypt aims to provide support to improve the health system in Uganda and other African countries.
fca177d54660b0adaf21744ce80b9497:
Egypt seeks to benefit from the UK's expertise in infrastructure projects.
Egypt and the UK discuss means of boosting joint cooperation in the different transport sectors.
Egypt wants to benefit from Britain's success story in the field of transport.
Egypt appreciates the current cooperation between Egypt and the UK to establish a monorail project that extends from the New Administrative Capital to the 6th of October City.
A consortium led by Bombardier Transportation, which is now part of Alstom, confirmed a deal with the Egyptian government to build two new monorails in Cairo.
Egypt’s first mass-transit link between Greater Cairo, the New Administrative Capital, and 6 October city, which extends over 100km will become one of the longest monorail system in the world.
The project will involve the construction of two monorail lines.
The first will extend for 56km from eastern Cairo to the New Administrative Capital.
The second, 43km long, will connect 6 October city and Giza.
The monorail will intersect with the Cairo metro Line 3 as well as the high-speed rail network.
The first line is set for completion by the end of 2022 and the second by April 2023.
9891a8d47e232cd4932498395c7331ff:
President Abdel-Fattah Al-Sisi attended the ninth trilateral summit between Egypt, Greece, and Cyprus in Athens on Tuesday.
The three countries signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) covering energy cooperation.
Egypt and Greece signed a MoU to build an undersea cable connecting their power grids.
Egypt and Cyprus signed a MoU to exchange up to two gigawatts of electricity.
The memoranda are part of the Euro-Africa $4 billion interconnector project, an electricity highway connecting the national grids of Egypt, Cyprus and Greece via a 1396km submarine cable.
The summit also saw the initialling of an agreement between the three states covering immigration.
The ninth trilateral summit is part of a cooperation mechanism launched in 2014 between Egypt, Greece, and Cyprus.
During the sixth summit in Crete in 2018 the three countries decided to establish the East Mediterranean Gas Forum (EMGF).
President Al-Sisi held bilateral meetings with the Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis and Cypriot President Nicos Anastasiades to discuss economic and trade relations, and regional files of mutual concern.
The 10th tripartite summit is scheduled for December.
4c3a28a20f98afeaa86459d83d8d3a60:
Egypt's health minister inaugurated a medical centre in Jinja, Uganda, to strengthen relations between the two countries.
Egypt has provided support and aid to 22 African countries in the fight against the COVID-19 pandemic.
Uganda and Egypt signed a military intelligence sharing agreement in April, allowing for the regular exchange of information on terrorism.
Egypt has been forging close ties with other Nile Basin countries, including Sudan and Burundi, to form an alliance against Ethiopia's Renaissance Dam.
Despite widespread criticism of its own healthcare system, Egypt has opened a medical centre in Uganda.
Egypt is currently in its fourth wave of COVID-19 but has not implemented preventative measures.
As of September, 600 doctors in Egypt have died since the start of the pandemic.
Critics have accused Egypt of sending medical aid to other countries for political gain, rather than addressing its own healthcare needs.
4aa2e227efef5a353ca13f9a77c5cff6:
Egyptian Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry met with Libyan interim Prime Minister Abdel-Hamid Dbeibah in Tripoli to discuss Libya's stability.
Egypt supports the roadmap agreed upon by Libyans and the exit of all military and armed foreign troops from Libya.
Delegates from 31 countries and international organizations are participating in the international conference to support Libyan stability.
The Tripoli conference comes two months ahead of planned parliamentary and presidential elections, which are scheduled for 24 December.
Egypt has affirmed on several occasions the necessity of holding the Libyan elections on schedule.
Libya's eastern-based parliament passed a no-confidence vote in the Libyan unity government in September.
The roadmap agreed upon by the Libyan Political Dialogue Forum and supported by the UN Security Council remains as the approach adopted by the international community to end the conflict in Libya.
Shoukry also met with Libyan Foreign Minister Najla Mangoush and his counterparts from Tunisia, Algeria, Greece, and Chad on the sidelines of the conference.
Dbeibah hailed Egypt’s role and supportive efforts to achieve stability in Libya, advance political settlement, and bring the views of Libyan parties closer.
a97eac2a3c72f0738c832df28dc11845:
Egypt's Arab Organisation for Industrialisation (AOI) set up a 4MW solar energy plant in Uganda's Tororo district.
The solar panels installed in the plant were produced by the AOI’s Arab Renewable Energy Company (ARECO).
The AOI is keen on exchanging expertise with Uganda and training technical workers on maintenance works.
The AOI has an ambitious plan to secure all the needs of local and African markets from electricity based on solar energy.
The new plant is an expression of Egypt's keenness to boost cooperation with Nile Basin countries.
Egypt has been involved in numerous development and infrastructure projects in Uganda and many African countries, including in the water, energy, and health fields.
Egypt inaugurated the AFri Egypt Medical Centre in Jinja, Uganda, as part of Egypt's efforts to bolster bilateral cooperation in various fields.
Egypt’s Arab Contractors and El-Sewedy Electric company are cooperating on the construction of the $2.9 billion Julius Nyerere Hydropower Station and Dam project in Tanzania.
Egypt’s state-owned Arab Contractors won a contract to establish a 150km-long road to the tune of 110 million euros in DR Congo.
414f48268ed300b258c9e8ad39ca171b:
Egypt and Qatar aim to enhance economic cooperation following recent reconciliation efforts.
Trade and Industry Minister Nevine Gamea and Qatar's Ambassador to Cairo Salem bin Mubarak Al-Shafi met to discuss bilateral cooperation.
Both countries seek to translate political agreements into concrete projects and increase trade exchange.
Gamea proposed establishing new frameworks for cooperation in commercial, investment, and industrial fields.
Qatari Ambassador Al-Shafi emphasized Egypt's strategic importance and called for boosting intra-regional trade and joint investments.
Egypt and Qatar have held several high-level talks since signing the Al-Ula reconciliation agreement in January.
The Arab quartet, including Egypt, restored diplomatic ties with Qatar after the Al-Ula Declaration.
d22c229c7802c553a2fd488230be55da:
Egyptian Minister of Industry and Trade Nevin Gamea met Qatar’s ambassador to Cairo, Salem Mubarak Al-Shafi, to discuss ways to further develop economic, trade and investment relations between the two countries.
Gamea said that both countries are intensifying efforts achieve further rapprochement at a political and economic level.
Gamea urged the importance of an Egyptian-Qatari trade committee to follow up on all bilateral cooperation projects.
Gamea invited the Qatari minister of trade to visit Cairo.
Al-Shafi said that Egypt offers “strategic depth” to the region, noting the desire of both countries to begin a new phase of bilateral cooperation.
Al-Shafi said that there is consensus between the two governments on a large number of joint cooperation files.
Al-Shafi praised the economic reforms and urban developments implemented by Egypt, and said that Qatari investment has remained strong in the Egyptian market, especially in finance and real estate.
43cba0d29ec196af76573cf39fe15ada:
The European Union (EU) has provided Egypt with more than €550 million in grants to address water challenges, leveraging funds of nearly €3 billion in the water resources sector.
The EU's existing programmes in Egypt extend to over 16 Governorates, provide nearly 20,000 permanent jobs and 600,000 short term job opportunities, mainly in rural areas.
The EU has been assisting with the planning of water management through support to the preparation of the National Water Resources Strategy for Egypt from 2017 through 2050 as well as the National Rural Sanitation Programme.
The EU has carried out several projects helping the Egyptian population on the ground, including the rehabilitation of the Kitchener Drain in the Delta region, helping to reduce pollution flowing into the Mediterranean.
The EU has recently proposed a new agenda for the Mediterranean, which includes a dedicated economic and investment plan to stimulate a long-term socio-economic development and recovery in the southern neighbourhood.
The EU, the European Investment Bank (EIB) and the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) are to prepare a large intervention on “Integrated Water and Food Security,” which is an investment that will support Egypt’s efforts to combat climate change, protect the environment and ensure sustainable food systems.
f3159ab8f4d6450f302509ba2bdb4798:
Egyptian Ambassador to Qatar, Amr Sherbini met with Qatari Minister of State for Foreign Affairs Soltan bin Saad Al Muraikhi in Doha.
Cairo and Doha held talks on bilateral relation and regional issues as part of efforts to bolster Egyptian-Qatari ties.
Saudi Arabia, Egypt, the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain mended ties with Qatar earlier this year by signing the AlUla Declaration.
Egyptian and Qatari foreign ministers have exchanged visits and Egyptian President Abdul Fattah al-Sisi held bilateral talks with Emir of Qatar Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani in Baghdad in August.
The Egyptian foreign ministry highlighted the rapprochement with Qatar, hoping cooperation can be further bolstered in the future.
caa2fadd16d54b93cb7ee6ac599824c3:
The European Investment Bank (EIB) expects to invest 1 billion euros in Egypt in 2021.
Egypt's government prioritizes water sector development, including water management, sanitation, and desalination.
The EIB has financed 13 water resource management projects in Egypt with 1 billion euros, and six more projects are underway.
The EIB supports Egypt's digital transformation and connectivity, including clean transportation in Cairo and Alexandria.
The EIB's total portfolio in Egypt is 7.5 billion euros, covering energy, transport, water, and the private sector.
Egypt has made significant progress in providing access to safe drinking water and sanitation services, with 98.7% coverage for drinking water and 66.7% coverage for sanitation.
Egypt is implementing a desalination plan to produce 1.3 million cubic meters of desalinated water per day, with 81 plants completed and 11 under construction.
e83470112138ac007679795890cd9306:
EU Commissioner for Neighborhood and Enlargement Oliver Varhelyi met with Egypt’s Minister of Water Resources and Irrigation Mohamed Abdel Aty.
EU Ambassador to Egypt Christian Berger expressed the EU’s interest in strengthening cooperation with Egypt in the water sector.
The EU has responded to water challenges in Egypt since 2007 through various programs.
The EU considers Egypt Vision 2030 and the National Strategy for Water Supply and Sanitation (2008-2037) as excellent frameworks for policy dialogue and investment guidance in the water sector.
The EU acknowledges the challenges associated with climate change and the insufficient financial means to address them, especially due to the coronavirus pandemic.
The EU is committed to providing grants and loans to enhance the benefits of cooperation in the water sector, especially with Egypt.
The EU prioritizes the water issue as a major determinant of sustainable development, with its associated economic and social dimensions.
The EU understands the importance of the Nile River for Egypt as the main source of water in the country.
The meeting between Abdel Aty and Varhelyi touched on issues of common interest, including climate change and migration.
0b584feb9a2c79eeb74325800b4d3b0d:
Speaker of Egypt’s House of Representatives Hanafy El-Gebaly and President of Romania Klaus Iohannis marked the 115th anniversary of establishing diplomatic relations between Egypt and Romania.
Egypt and Romania will work together to reinforce relations to serve the interests of both.
Romania’s president said his current visit to Egypt reflects the growing relations between Cairo and Bucharest.
They also discussed fostering political and parliamentary relations between Egypt and Romania.
El-Gebaly and Iohannis opened an exhibition that includes several historical documents that chronicle the relations between Egypt and Romania.
Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah El-Sisi had discussed in a meeting earlier Wednesday with his Romanian counterpart means of developing cooperation between both countries, particularly in the energy, investment, industry, trade, and tourism fields.
850445e3a20d918da835e2ec7f2de41f:
Libya's 5+5 military commission started a new round of United Nations-sponsored talks in Cairo, Egypt on Saturday to discuss means of expelling the foreign forces and mercenaries from Libya.
The two-day meeting is attended by UN special envoy for Libya Ján Kubiš, and representatives from neighboring countries.
Libya is set to hold the presidential elections on December 24 under the UN-backed roadmap.
Egypt hosted a host of Libyan dialogue meetings to bridge the gap between various Libyan parties.
b1ff76460a9e678c20eb5548547b3c88:
UN Special Envoy Jan Kubis arrived in Cairo to discuss Libyan developments, including the withdrawal of mercenaries.
Kubis will meet with Egyptian officials and Arab League members to review the situation in Libya ahead of December elections.
UN observers have arrived in Libya to monitor the ceasefire and foreign force withdrawal under the Joint Military Commission.
Kubis previously visited Egypt in September to participate in the Council of Arab Foreign Ministers and discuss Libya.
0268287d8e7df4445b1c891a48a4bcbc:
United Kingdom’s Minister for the Middle East and North Africa James Cleverly said that Egypt has achieved revolutionary progress in the energy field, putting Cairo on the path to achieving energy security.
Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah El-Sisi arrived in Scotland to participate in the COP 26 summit.
Egypt has advanced from 26th place in 2020 to the 20th among the world’s top 40 markets in the Renewable Energy Country Attractiveness Index for 2021.
Egypt plans to increase the supply of electricity generated from renewable sources to 20 percent by 2022 and up to 42 percent by 2035.
The UK is interested in investing in renewables in Egypt, as evidenced by the newly signed deal between the UK’s Globeleq and the Egyptian government’s Benban Solar Energy Park.
Cleverly discussed with Egyptian Transportation Minister Kamel El-Wazir investments opportunities in the transport sector’s infrastructure in Egypt.
The UK understands the importance of the Nile to Egypt and hopes that Egypt, Sudan, and Ethiopia reach a deal through the negotiations on the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam.
137fcd674e153ab99bf06cb9ce1eb8a7:
Qatar considers Egypt a fertile ground for investment due to its positive improvements in all fields, especially in the investment climate.
Qatari investments in Egypt increased by 77.8 percent to $679.4 million in FY2019/2020.
Trade exchange between Egypt and Qatar increased by 11.8 percent in 2020 to $22.7 million.
Egypt plans to raise the private sector's contribution to the country's economic activity to 50 percent over the coming three years.
Egypt's government has managed to create a healthy environment for foreign and local investments in different areas.
Egypt's government acts to enlarge the initial public offering (IPO) programme through listing more state-owned companies.
Egypt's economic reforms have improved the country's economic indicators and achieved the developmental and fiscal objectives during FY2020/2021.
Egypt posted an initial surplus of 1.4 percent of the GDP, decreased the budget's overall deficit to 7.4 percent, and achieved a 3.3 percent in real GDP growth in FY2020/2021.
Egypt's Ministry of Finance is upgrading Egypt's customs and tax systems to streamline the procedures for investors and lay the foundation of tax justice.
The application of the advanced cargo information (ACI) system in Egypt's seaports would significantly reduce customs clearance measures, facilitate trade flow, and lure investment.
1cdde28b0de4690cf83cbad9baa34c42:

Egypt inked seven development financing grant agreements with the US worth $125 million through USAID.
The signed agreements are expected to play a role in stimulating Egypt’s government efforts in developing the sectors of basic education, higher education, science and technology, agriculture, health, economic governance, trade, and investment.
The agreements allocate $17 million to the sector of basic education; $31 million to the US-Egypt Higher Education Initiative (HEI); $4 million to US-Egyptian cooperation in the sector of science and technology; $27 million to economic governance; $5 million to agriculture and rural development; and $28 million to bolstering trade and investment in Egypt.
The strategic partnership with the US integrates with the national efforts of developing various sectors to achieve social and economic development.
The ministry is currently designing a new programme with USAID to ensure the economic and social empowerment of women in collaboration with relevant stakeholders.
The US Government’s $30 billion investment in Egypt over the last 40 years has brought clean water and wastewater services to 25 million Egyptians, eliminated polio, built 2,000 schools, and provided 4,000 university scholarships.
Egypt’s cooperation portfolio with the USAID since 2014 has reached about $900 million in implementing priority projects in education, higher education, governance, small- and medium-sized enterprises, tourism, agriculture, and the private sector.
The total development cooperation portfolio between Egypt and the USA since 1978 amounts to over $30 billion, covering various sectors that represent development priorities for Egypt’s government.

Egypt's Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry called for the unconditional and simultaneous exit of all foreign forces from Libya without exception.

A UN report published in March said that the arms embargo imposed on Libya by the UN Security Council in 2011 remains "totally ineffective."
Shoukry and Kubiš stressed the importance of holding the Libyan parliamentary and presidential elections on time on 24 December.
They warned against any attempt to delay the elections, saying such a step would have negative repercussions on Libyan security and stability.
Libya's 5+5 military mission, formed in early 2020, was the agreed third track to ensure the withdrawal of all foreign fighters from Libya.
Egypt hosted a host of meetings to bridge the gap between various Libyan parties and foster dialogue.

President Abdel-Fattah El-Sisi and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson agreed to strengthen the UK’s engagement in implementing Egypt’s priority development plans.

6e1af344e37e8d8ab075211cb99b085b:
Brazilian ambassador to Cairo, Antonio Patriota, opened an exhibition of photographs entitled “Back to Egypt” in partnership with the Egyptian Ministry of Culture.
The exhibition features a collection of pictures of Egypt from the 19th century, owned by the Brazilian emperor Pedro II, who reigned in Brazil from 1831 to 1889.
The exhibition coincides with the 150th anniversary of the Brazilian emperor's first trip to Egypt and will be open for visitation from November 3 to 30, at the Gezira Art Center, in Zamalek.
The exhibition includes 92 pictures of historic landmarks, buildings, mosques, Pompey's Pillar in Alexandria, the Nile, among other archaeological sites, as well as 11 information panels describing both visits by the emperor to Egypt.
The book by Brazilian researcher Roberto Khatlab, “The travels of Pedro II: Middle East and North Africa, 1871 and 1876 [As viagens de D. Pedro II: Oriente Médio e África do Norte, 1871 e 1876]” was a reference for the creation of the exhibition.
4be94e053fc46bac70ad719b851af64e:
Egypt’s Tourism and Antiquities Minister Khaled El-Anany held talks with his British counterpart Nigel Huddleston to enhance tourism cooperation between Egypt and the UK.
Egypt was recently removed from the UK’s travel “red list.”
El-Anany reviewed the latest COVID-19 preventive measures, health and safety protocols in Egypt.
El-Anany talked about new tourism developments in Egypt, including the operation of a new airline between Sharm El-Sheikh and Luxor.
7f83e4a852ebfeac57771c9712534e60:
Egypt and Switzerland launched a cooperation programme for 2021-2024 to focus on Egypt's transition towards a green economy and adaption to climate change.

Switzerland supports Egypt's transition towards a green economy and adaption to climate change through providing innovative contributions across sectors of clean energy, green financing, supporting macro reforms in Egypt’s economy, and achieving development and improving the business environment.
Egypt's Minister of International Cooperation Rania Al-Mashat expounded that the new cooperation programme with Switzerland comes within the government’s unremitting efforts to implement inclusive economic and social reforms with the aim of scaling up the Egyptian economy’s competitiveness, achieving sustainable development, and leading the region in the transition towards a green economy, as well as in combating climate change.
The partnership between Egypt and Switzerland extends for more than 40 years, during which the Swiss side has contributed more than 700 million Swiss francs to finance the implementation of more than 200 projects in various sectors in Egypt.
The ongoing development cooperation portfolio between the two countries amounts to $58 million to finance seven projects in industry, urban development, water, housing, waste management, communications and health sectors.

French economists praised Egypt's economic reforms over the past seven years for boosting GDP growth and creating an investment-friendly environment.

The United Nations and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs co-organised a ceremony on 8 November at Tahrir Palace in Cairo to commemorate the 76th anniversary of the United Nations.
The event highlighted the long-standing relationship between the UN and Egypt, ways of reinforcing multilateralism and tackling global challenges, and the different areas of cooperation between the UN in Egypt and Egypt’s government.
Ihab Badawy, the assistant foreign minister for multilateral and international security, said that commemorating the UN’s 76th anniversary is “an opportunity to reaffirm our belief in the importance of collective multilateral action to address issues of joint interest.”
UN Resident Coordinator in Egypt Elena Panova said that “the bonds of cooperation between Egypt and the UN are solid. It is grounded with the values and principles of the UN Charter.”
UN Secretary-General António Guterres said that the values that have powered the UN charter for the last 76 years — peace, development, human rights, and opportunity for all — have no expiry date.
Since 1945, Egypt has been a strong partner in multilateral action. Egypt is one of the largest contributors to peacekeeping forces and has been an elected member of the Security Council five times.
Egypt chaired multiple UN commissions, including the UN Peacekeeping Commission, and the Group of 77 at the United Nations in New York in 2018 and in Rome in 2019.
Egypt also hosts about 38 United Nations offices and can be considered one of the largest regional centres of the organisation.
