Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett's visit to Bahrain has caused outrage, prompting protests and the burning of the Israeli flag.
Ottawa's police chief resigns amid criticism that he did not do enough to stop anti-vax protests that have paralyzed the Canadian capital.
Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau invoked emergency powers to end protests that have severely affected the country's economy.
44925c6baba24e2495a0c8d298e26c9e:
Iranian President Ebrahim Raeisi says any Vienna deal must entail the removal of anti-Iran sanctions and the provision of credible guarantees.
Iran's foreign minister says the revival of the 2015 deal hinges on the political decisions made by the other sides.
Canadian police have clashed with protesters in Ottawa, using pepper spray and stun grenades to disperse the weeks-long demonstrations against COVID restrictions.
Organizers of the so-called Freedom Convoy said they have asked trucks to withdraw because of heavy-handed police tactics.
A fierce Atlantic storm has wreaked havoc across northwestern Europe killing at least 14 people and causing massive power outages.
Storm Eunice pummeled Britain with record breaking winds ripping off rooftops and knocking nearly one million homes off the power grid.
Deaths from the storm were reported in Britain, the Netherlands, Belgium and Ireland, which were caused by flying debris and falling trees.
f28282c80631f9467bd8059dd921d584:
Iran's President Ebrahim Raeisi says any agreement to revive the 2015 JCPOA deal requires the removal of anti-Iran sanctions while ensuring the interests of the Iranian nation with credible guarantees.
The United Nations denounces the Israeli regime for its plan to evict Palestinian families from their ancestral homes in the Sheikh Jarrah neighborhood of occupied al-Quds.
Tensions along Russia’s border with Ukraine are escalating. Moscow says a shell fired from Ukraine has destroyed a border facility that was used by the Russian border guard service.
4276a95532c2ed9e83d9482aa6349b50:
Russia recognizes the independence of two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine, accusing the West-backed government in Kiev of committing genocide there.
Russian President Vladimir Putin demands that Kiev immediately end military operations or face responsibility for possible bloodshed.
Putin tells the country’s defense ministry to deploy troops to the two regions under a peacekeeping mission.
Iran’s President Ebrahim Raeisi slams US sanctions on the oil and gas industry of some member states.
Raeisi calls for boosting cooperation among the member states to circumvent those measures.
China issues a warning to the United States over its plan to include Taiwan in its Indo-Pacific strategy.
China's foreign minister says Washington’s move is sending all the wrong signals.
China strongly opposes Washington's increased military and political support for Taiwan.
Beijing imposes sanctions on two American firms over a pending 100-million dollar arms sale to Taiwan.
32361db3e7fda9d749322cfea11751a8:
Russian President Vladimir Putin authorizes a special military operation in Ukraine’s Donbass region.
Putin says NATO's expansion to include Ukraine is unacceptable and that Russia has been left with no choice but to defend itself against threats emanating from Ukraine.
Putin says Russia has NO plans to occupy Ukrainian territory.
Putin called on the Ukrainian military forces to lay down their arms and go home.
President Volodymyr Zelensky says that Ukraine is ready for anything and that it will win.
Hezbollah Secretary-General Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah warns Israel against waging a war on Lebanon.
Nasrallah says the Israeli regime is on the decline and on the path to demise.
Nasrallah says Hezbollah seeks justice and peace, and would defend the Lebanese people and their freedom.
The United States imposes sanctions on a number of entities and individuals, accusing them of providing tens of millions of dollars to Yemen’s Ansarullah movement.
The action freezes any assets of the designated individuals that are subject to U-S jurisdiction and bars Americans from doing business with them.
The war in Yemen, which started in 2015, has so far killed hundreds of thousands of Yemenis, mostly civilians.
The United Nations says the country is facing the world's worst humanitarian crisis.
3331c2a5f9ad9e55d09f74274d201e51:
Russia claims to have taken over Kherson, a southern Ukrainian port city on the Black Sea, while Ukrainian officials deny the claim.
A blast occurred near the central train station in Kiev, caused by falling wreckage of a downed missile, according to Ukrainian officials.
Russia claims around 500 fatalities among its forces, while Ukraine claims over 7,000 Russian troops have been killed since the start of the operation.
The Russian defense ministry says nearly 3,000 Ukrainian soldiers have been killed and over 3,700 wounded.
A prosecutor of the International Criminal Court confirms an investigation into possible war crimes would be opened soon.
Russia and Ukraine are preparing for the second round of cease-fire talks.
Iran blames the United States and NATO for the ongoing Russian military action against Ukraine and escalating tensions between the two neighbors.
Iran abstained from voting on a UN resolution on the Ukraine-Russia conflict, citing a lack of impartiality and realistic mechanisms for resolving the crisis peacefully.
The Yemeni foreign minister denounces a UN Security Council resolution that extends an arms embargo on the Ansarullah movement as shameful and ridiculous.
The resolution was adopted in the wake of retaliatory attacks by the Ansarullah movement against Saudi Arabia and the UAE.
02cdd9089cf31961cb61bfc3920c1225:
IAEA chief Rafael Grossi says safeguards issues with Iran should be resolved to revive the 2015 deal.
Grossi met with Iran’s atomic energy organization head Mohammad Eslami in Tehran.
Iran’s Supreme National Security Council Secretary Ali Shamkhani calls Israel the biggest enemy of the Muslim world.
Saudi crown prince Mohammad bin Salman says Riyadh is looking for ways to coexist with Iran but doesn’t look at Israel as an enemy.
Russia announces a ceasefire to allow residents of Mariupol and Volnovakha to evacuate.
The ceasefire has taken effect on 7 GMT Saturday in Mariupol and Volnovakha.
aaa7848ad9a9781709ddcd6fc15cf600:
Russia warns of unpredictable and catastrophic consequences if the US and European Union ban imports of oil from Russia.
Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak said crude prices could surge to over 300 dollars per barrel if the US and European Union ban imports of oil from Russia.
Oil prices have already spiked close to 140 dollars per barrel, the highest since the 2008 financial crisis.
Russia could cut gas supplies via the Nord Stream 1 pipeline to Germany.
Western sanctions on Moscow, coupled with logistics turmoil, have also shaken markets for other commodities.
The US wheat futures rose more than 7-percent, nearing an all-time high amid fears of supply chaos.
European wheat has already hit record highs.
Russia is the world's biggest wheat exporter.
Together with Ukraine, Russia accounts for about 29-percent of global wheat exports.
European shares fell to their lowest in a year, with Germany and Italy’s benchmark index slipping into a so-called bear market.
Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amir-Abdollahian says his country opposes both war and sanctions.
Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amir-Abdollahian says Tehran’s cooperation with any country, including Russia, should not be affected by sanctions.
Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov slammed the sanctions imposed on his country, and stressed the need for closer cooperation between Moscow and Tehran.
Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amir-Abdollahian told Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu that Tehran supports efforts to find a political solution for the Ukraine conflict and stands ready to lend a helping hand.
Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu said he will participate in a joint meeting with his Russian and Ukrainian counterparts to facilitate a ceasefire.
Israeli forces kill another Palestinian in the occupied West Bank city of al-Quds, bringing to three the number of Palestinians killed since Sunday.
Tensions are running high in the occupied territories over Israel’s brutal crackdown on Palestinians venting anger at the regime’s atrocious policies.
da54d88ec0101bf87eaba5fb37816399:
JCPOA revival talks are paused at the request of the European Union foreign policy chief.
Iran says the pause could provide a momentum for resolving the remaining issues.
Iran’s foreign ministry spokesman stresses that no external factor can affect the parties’ joint will to go forward for a collective agreement.
The EU foreign policy chief suggested a temporary halt to the talks due to what he called external factors.
The EU’s top negotiator has expressed hope that the parties would be able to resume negotiations very soon.
European Union leaders meet for the second day in France for talks over the Russian offensive in Ukraine.
They’ve dismissed Kiev’s appeal for rapid accession to the bloc, following divisions among the leaders over the demand.
France is also opposed to Ukraine’s fast EU membership.
The EU has also remained divided on the scope of further sanctions against Russia over Ukraine.
Yemen’s armed forces say they have carried out a large-scale drone operation targeting Saudi Arabia’s oil facilities.
The spokesman for the Yemeni army says they have targeted a Saudi Aramco refinery in Riyadh using three Sammaad-3 drones.
The operation, codenamed Breaking the Siege One, was a response to Riyadh’s fuel embargo on Yemen.
The Saudi state news agency has cited a government official as confirming that a refinery in Riyadh was attacked on Thursday.
bba55b7e8616af8246fcdf74cbd247b8:
YouTube blocks access to Russian government-funded media globally.
Meta allows posts calling for violence against Russian forces.
Moscow restricts access to Instagram and launches criminal proceedings against Meta.
UN warns anti-Moscow move could spark hate speech against Russians.
Iran calls for political resolution to Russia-Ukraine conflict.
Iran offers humanitarian aid to Ukrainian refugees in Poland.
Iran reserves right to respond to Israeli attack in Syria that killed two military advisors.
Iran describes Israeli attack as criminal act that violates international law.
2558e889058a21b01c9d4b0af201ed3a:
Iran’s Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) has conducted missile strikes on a strategic Israeli center in the capital of Iraq’s Kurdistan region.
The IRGC says its precision-strike missiles hit the center in response to the crimes of the Zionists.
The IRGC has warned Israel of a strong and destructive response if it repeats its acts of aggression.
Footage emerged on Sunday of explosions in the Iraqi city of Erbil.
Media reports suggested the target had been secret centers operated by the Israeli spy agency Mossad.
It was also reported that the strike had destroyed a building and killed several Mossad officers.
Earlier this week, two Iranian military advisors were killed in Israeli airstrikes near the Syrian capital Damascus.
Following that attack, the IRGC said Israel would definitely pay the price for its criminal act.
Russia-Ukraine conflict: Day 18
Russian forces have advanced closer to Kiev from several directions.
In the nearby town of Irpin, a US journalist was killed and another wounded.
To the west, a Russian missile attack hit a large military facility near the border with Poland, killing 35 people.
Another nine people lost their lives in airstrikes on the southern city of Mykolayiv.
Eastward in Mariupol, officials say nearly 2,200 residents have been killed since the start of the conflict.
They also say the port city, under Russian siege, is running out of food and water.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky says Russia is blocking a humanitarian convoy heading to Mariupol.
China COVID lockdown
Millions of people across China are facing lockdowns amid a surge in coronavirus infections.
The sharp rise in cases has prompted authorities to close schools in Shanghai and put all 17 million residents in the southeastern city of Shenzhen under a citywide lockdown.
Almost 18 provinces are battling clusters of the Omicron and Delta variants.
The latest flare-up has been driven by the highly transmissible Omicron strain and a spike in asymptomatic cases.
China, where the virus was first detected in late 2019, has maintained a strict zero-Covid policy enforced by swift lockdowns, travel restrictions and mass testing, when clusters have emerged.
beea6a3e6c9e9340fead16b9de958f50:
Russia and Ukraine have given their most upbeat assessments yet of progress in their negotiations on the ongoing Russian offensive in Ukraine.
Kiev said it was willing to negotiate, but not to surrender or accept any ultimatums.
Ukraine also made it clear that it wanted an end to the war and the complete withdrawal of Russian troops from its soil.
Russia said the talks had made substantial progress, and will continue on Monday.
The US said Russia was showing signs of willingness to engage in substantive negotiations on ending the Ukraine conflict.
Iran's top security official highlights the balance between field and diplomacy in his country’s policy.
Iran's Islamic Revolution Guards Corps carried out a strike on a strategic Israeli center in the Iraqi city of Erbil.
The IRGC says its precision-strike missiles hit the center in response to the crimes of the Zionists.
The IRGC has warned Israel of a strong and destructive response if it repeats its acts of aggression.
Two Iranian military advisors were killed in Israeli airstrikes near the Syrian capital Damascus.

Iranian Foreign Minister Hussein Amirabdollahian dismisses Western allegations that Moscow could stand in the way of an agreement to revive the 2015 deal, known as the JCPOA.
Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov says Russia seeks the swift revival of the JCPOA and that the US should rejoin the agreement and remove sanctions on Iran.
Russia says its forces have taken full control of the southern region of Kherson.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky says his country should recognize that it will not join the NATO alliance.
Twenty-year-old Alaa Shaham was slain by Israeli forces in the occupied al-Quds.
09db5907064911565b27c328199cc86a:
Israel's former Attorney General Avichai Mendelblit ordered the police to halt the use of NSO Group's Pegasus spyware except in cases where lives are at risk, just before leaving office.
Mendelblit called for forming an investigative team to look into allegations that the police had used the spyware illegally.
A senior police official stated that the cyber-SIGINT unit operated independently without oversight and likely used the spyware to develop intelligence information unlawfully.
Reports revealed the purported illegal use of the spyware by the police against individuals like Netanyahu's son Avner, co-defendant Iris Elovitch, disability rights leaders, journalists, businessman Rami Levy, mayors, and Finance Ministry officials.
The police initially confirmed using Pegasus spyware only against Israeli mayors suspected of criminal activity pursuant to court orders.
Mendelblit had directed the police to take immediate steps to prevent exceeding their authority regarding the spyware's use.
The police previously admitted misusing surveillance software but denied it was NSO's Pegasus spyware.
